subject: Career
title: Network Effects in Career Growth
description: A 60-second lesson on Network Effects in Career Growth.

hook.text: The first 50 connections are slow. The next 500 come from the first 50. That's the network effect.

buildup.text: Metcalfe's Law: the value of a network grows proportionally to the square of its participants.

discovery.text: Each new connection doesn't just add one relationship â€” it adds potential paths to everyone they know.

twist.text: But network effects have diminishing returns for individuals. 10,000 connections isn't 100x better than 100.

climax.text: Focus on connecting well-placed nodes. Quality connections with connectors multiply your reach.

quiz.question: What does Metcalfe's Law say about networks?
options: Value grows proportionally to the square of participants
